description.text: The Camino Fisterra leaves Santiago de Compostella and heads West, to Fisterra/Finisterre, the End of the World@en
notes: The final destination for the Camino Fisterra is the Faro de Fisterra lighthouse. This is about 3km from the town. To faithfully show the effort invoved, there are two "Fisterra"s. One represents the town you pass through on your way to the lighthouse. The other is journey's end.

accommodation.name: Rectoral San Mamede da Pena Hostel

pois.name: Punto de Información ao Peregrino de Hospital (Dumbría)@ga

locations.name: Fisterra (Outgoing)
locations.description: This is Fisterra as a waypoint, on the way to Faro de Fisterra. See "Fisterra (Return)" for the final point of the journey.

notes: You can get your pilgrim's document, the Finisterrana, at the lighthouse.@en

description.text: This is Fisterra on return from the Faro de Fisterra. See "Fisterra (Outgoing)" for Fisterra as a waypoint.@en
notes: You can get your pilgrim's document, the Finisterrana, at the tourism office or the lighthouse. The tourism office is closed during the low season and the Finisterrana can be obtained at the pilgrim albergue.@en
You can get your pilgrim's document, the Muxiana, at the tourism office, the Bela Muxia hostel or the town hall.@en

name: Oficina Municipal de Turismo de Muxía@ga
Tourism Office@en

description.text: An alternative route to just past A Canosa, following the estuary and coast. This route is approximately 1km longer than the standard route.@en

routes.name: Camino Fisterra
routes.description: The main Camino route starting in Stantiago de Compostella and following the Southern route

routes.name: Muxia Variant
routes.description: A longer variant that travels North to Muxia and then Southwards to Fisterra
